title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: ggOxford package provides functions plotting visualising data according particular theme pallette. types plots supported package include box plots, forest plots bar charts. package also allows creation mock data sets, mockForestPlotData, well providing functions mockSummariseLargeScaleCharacteristics mockSummarisedResult user’s convenience.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install latest version ggOxford like :

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: create box plot, use command “my_data” dataset use “variable” variable plot . example,
code: box_plot(my_data, group_level, strata_name, strata_level, variable) my_data <- mockSummarisedResult(seed = 1, as.Date("2021-01-01"), as.Date("2021-12-31"), 100) group_level <- "Cohort 1" strata_name <- "Overall" strata_level <- "Overall" variable <- "age" box_plot(my_data,"Cohort 1","Overall","Overall","age")

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: create forest plot, use command “my_data” dataset use, “outcomelabels” column containing labels, “lowCi”, “highCi” low high 95 % confidence interval values respectively. example, df <- data.frame( label = paste0(“X”, 1:6), mean = c(1.30, 0.62, 2.00, 1.10, 0.83, 1.4), lower = c(0.80, 0.49, 1.50, 1.04, 0.72, 1.11), upper = c(2.01, 0.97, 3.00, 1.25, 1.08, 1.56) ) result <- forestPlot(df, “label”, “mean”, “lower”, “upper”)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: use function mockSummarisedResult, employ command “seed” seed random mock data generated, “startDate”, “endDate” start end dates data, “populationSize” size population use. example, > mockSummarisedResult(1, .Date(“2021-01-01”), .Date(“2021-12-31”), 10) # tibble: 404 × 9 group_name group_level strata_name strata_level variable variable_level variable_type  1 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall number subjec… NA NA 2 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall number records NA NA 3 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_start_… NA date 4 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_start_… NA date 5 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_start_… NA date 6 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_start_… NA date 7 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_start_… NA date 8 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_end_da… NA date 9 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_end_da… NA date 10 cohort_name Cohort 1 Overall Overall cohort_end_da… NA date # ℹ 394 rows # ℹ 2 variables: estimate_type , estimate  # ℹ Use print(n = ...) see rows

title: Boxplot ggOxford — box_plot
text: Boxplot ggOxford

title: Boxplot ggOxford — box_plot
code: box_plot(   data,   group_level = "Cohort 1",   strata_name = "Overall",   strata_level = "Overall",   variable = "age" )

title: Boxplot ggOxford — box_plot
text: data dataset group_level group_level dataset strata_name strata_name dataset strata_level strata_level dataset variable variable box plot plot

title: Boxplot ggOxford — box_plot
text: box plot

title: Forest Plot - Oxford-Pharmacoepi style — forestPlot
text: Forest Plot - Oxford-Pharmacoepi style

title: Forest Plot - Oxford-Pharmacoepi style — forestPlot
text: data Include data frame. outcomelabels name column including  labels. go within " ". estimate include name column RR, IR, HR, etc. go within " ". lowCi include name column low 95% confidence interval value. go within " ". highCi include name column high 95% confidence interval value. go within " ".

title: Function to create mock summarised large-scale characteristics. — mockSummariseLargeScaleCharacteristics
code: mockSummariseLargeScaleCharacteristics(   populationSize = 10,   window = list(c(-Inf, -366), c(-365, -31), c(-30, -1), c(1, 30), c(31, 365), c(366,     Inf)),   eventInWindow = "condition_occurrence",   episodeInWindow = "drug_exposure" )

title: Function to create mock summarised large-scale characteristics. — mockSummariseLargeScaleCharacteristics
text: populationSize Number individuals window Set temporal windows consider eventInWindow Table characterise events window episodeInWindow Table characterise episodes window

title: Function to create a mock summarised result tibble. — mockSummarisedResult
text: seed Seed value random mock data generated startDate Start date mock data endDate End date mock data populationSize choose size population

title: Function to create a mock summarised result tibble. — mockSummarisedResult
code: # \donttest{ library(ggoxford)  mockSummarisedResult(seed = 1,as.Date("2021-01-01"),as.Date("2021-12-31")) #> # A tibble: 663 × 9 #>    group_name group_level strata_name strata_level variable       variable_level #>    <chr>      <chr>       <chr>       <chr>        <chr>          <chr>          #>  1 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      number subjec… NA             #>  2 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      number records NA             #>  3 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_start_… NA             #>  4 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_start_… NA             #>  5 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_start_… NA             #>  6 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_start_… NA             #>  7 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_start_… NA             #>  8 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_end_da… NA             #>  9 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_end_da… NA             #> 10 Overall    Overall     Overall     Overall      cohort_end_da… NA             #> # ℹ 653 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: variable_type <chr>, estimate_type <chr>, estimate <chr> # }
